headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Utseya 73 (91b 5x4 0x6 132m) SR: 80.21

dismissalComment.html: a terrible shot to get out, he misses the reverse scoop to a full delivery and he was struck on the pad in front of the stumps and the umpire had no other choice but to give it in favor of the bowler.

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c SW Masakadza b Utseya 63 (73b 5x4 1x6 86m) SR: 86.3

dismissalComment.html: sweeps it well in the air but unlucky to pick out the fielder at deep backward square leg, Maskadza takes the catch. A good knock from Mushfiqur comes to an end.

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Utseya strikes for Zimbabwe, it was too full for the sweep and he misses it and the ball strikes the pad in line and a loud shout, given by the umpire. Bangladesh are three down for 47

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: sweeps and gets a glove and the ball lobs up in the air behind the wicket on the onside, Taibu leaps backwards and takes a splendid catch to dismiss Kayes.
sweeps it well in the air but unlucky to pick out the fielder at deep backward square leg, Maskadza takes the catch. A good knock from Mushfiqur comes to an end.

a terrible shot to get out, he misses the reverse scoop to a full delivery and he was struck on the pad in front of the stumps and the umpire had no other choice but to give it in favor of the bowler.

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: wicket for Price as Shuvo charges down the track and looks to go big on the onside, misses it completely and an easy take for Taibu, who gets rid of the bails to dismiss Shuvo.

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Mpofu 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh lose their first wicket and it is the big wicket of Tamim, pitches in line with the stumps and strikes the pad, loud appeal and given by the umpire this time. Tamim was not happy, he shows his bat, saying there was an inside edge, but I thought it was a bit high and going down leg too.

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Zunaed Siddique c Utseya b SW Masakadza 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: Zimbabwe get the second wicket, Junaid goes, he flicks it in the air on the onside, Utseya at square leg dives sideways to his right and plucks the ball with one hand in the air, excellent stuff from Utseya, the small crowd present at the ground are stunned.

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya c Imrul Kayes b Shafiul Islam 67 (101b 3x4 3x6 130m) SR: 66.33

dismissalComment.html: full toss and Utseya down the track, hits it in the air to deep midwicket and Kayes takes the catch. The umpires check if it was a noball, but it is fine.

dismissalText.long: st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 24 (41b 4x4 0x6 40m) SR: 58.53

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery from Shakib, spins and turns away as Cremer misses the drive, Mushfiqur collects the ball and whips off the bails to dismiss Cremer.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: arm ball does the trick for Razzak, comes in with the arm and Chibhabha on the back foot is struck on the pad in line with the stumps and a loud shout, given by the umpire, Razzak strikes in his first over.

tosses it up nicely, teasing Masakadza, comes down the track and looking to go down the ground on the onside, the turn misses the bat and through to Mushfiqur, who gets the rid of the stumps to dismiss Masakadza.
lovely delivery, Taylor stays in the crease and pokes at the delivery as it was turning away, gets the edge and through to Junaid at first slip. Zimbabwe lose their third wicket.

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: fuller on the middle stump. Chakabva looks to have a swipe across the line. When you tend to do it, you have to ensure you get some bat on it, Chakabva doesn't and he is plumb in front. In fact Chakabva was set up for the dismissal as he was beaten with the turn two deliveries ago and now he slips a straight one

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edge and gone, Shafiul strikes picks up his first wicket, pitches it back of a length and makes it move away, Ervine feels for it and gets the edge through to Mushfiqur, who is happy to accept it. Zimbabwe in a spot of bother and are reeling at 39 for 4.

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: short delivery outside the off stump, upper cuts and slices it high in the air and behind the wicket on the off side, Mushfiqur calls for it and settles under the ball to take the catch.

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: Price backs away and chips it in the air to Shuvo at extra cover, Shafiul and Price face off, few words being uttered. A jig from Shuvo.
full toss and Utseya down the track, hits it in the air to deep midwicket and Kayes takes the catch. The umpires check if it was a noball, but it is fine.

dismissalText.commentary: Tatenda Taibu b Mashrafe Mortaza 3 (23b 0x4 0x6 40m) SR: 13.04

dismissalComment.html: Mortaza cleans up Taibu, it was on a length and Taibu misjuding the line, moves forward and shoulders arms and then he realizes that he has made a mistake as the ball disturbs the timber. Zimbabwe are completely down now.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya c Imrul Kayes b Shafiul Islam 67 (101b 3x4 3x6 130m) SR: 66.33

commentTextItems.html: full toss and Utseya down the track, hits it in the air to deep midwicket and Kayes takes the catch. The umpires check if it was a noball, but it is fine.

commentPostTextItems.html: Thanks for being with us, do join us again on Dec 10th for the 4th ODI, until then this is Binoy George and along with Raghav saying cheers for now.

Razzak (Man-of-the-Match) : Two matches in a row now for Razzak. "I am really happy today, the bowling was fantastic, was very happy with the wicket. About the catch he dropped, I could not see the ball."

Shakib: "Throughout the day, the wicket was helpful for the seamers and spinners. We have been playing good cricket, if the top-order did not click, the middle-order played and other way round too, someone is contributing. Mashrafe has bowled well today and very happy with Razzak's efforts."

Utseya: "It was a juicy wicket, it is unfortunate that we did not take our chances. we missed a stumping chance, we did not try our best in the middle innings. it was a learning curve against the left arm spinners."

The players shake hands, Bangladesh win by 65 runs and leads the series 2-1. Zimbabwe were never in the game after they were 6 down for 47, Razzak doing the damage. The only respectful knock came from Utseya.

Ravi: "This has become ususal with Zim. They start the series with a good win and let things off the hooke. Winning a match in foreign soil is good. Perhaps, ZIM should focus on winning more than one match."

commentTextItems.html: low full toss driven through mid-on .

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full toss hit down the ground to long on.
sweeps it through square leg to the fence, slaps it.
down the leg side, Mushfiqur fails to gather it.
another massive hit from Utseya, swings it high and goes a long way over the midwicket fence.
pushes to the off side.
goes all way as Utseya charges at Shakib, he lofts it high and over the midwicket fence.
goes through Mpofu as he pushes at the delivery.

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: attempted yorker, played back to the bowler.
another short delivery and off the glove square of the wicket to the off side.
short rising delivery and Mpofu fends it off to the off side.
mistimes the drive to mid-on.
pushes to the onside to mid-on and gets to his 50.
comes forward and looks to defend, gets an inside edge, lucky that otherwise it was all over, loud appeal and not given.

commentPostTextItems.html: Razzak finishes a wonderful spell of bowling, 14 runs for 4 wickets in 10 overs.

commentTextItems.html: clips it through square leg to the deep.
tossed up delivery and an edge to short fine leg.
cut behind point, slight misfield but no run taken.
pushes to the onside forward of square leg.
down the leg side.

headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Utseya strikes for Zimbabwe, it was too full for the sweep and he misses it and the ball strikes the pad in line and a loud shout, given by the umpire. Bangladesh are three down for 47

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: sweeps and gets a glove and the ball lobs up in the air behind the wicket on the onside, Taibu leaps backwards and takes a splendid catch to dismiss Kayes.
sweeps it well in the air but unlucky to pick out the fielder at deep backward square leg, Maskadza takes the catch. A good knock from Mushfiqur comes to an end.

a terrible shot to get out, he misses the reverse scoop to a full delivery and he was struck on the pad in front of the stumps and the umpire had no other choice but to give it in favor of the bowler.

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Mpofu 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh lose their first wicket and it is the big wicket of Tamim, pitches in line with the stumps and strikes the pad, loud appeal and given by the umpire this time. Tamim was not happy, he shows his bat, saying there was an inside edge, but I thought it was a bit high and going down leg too.

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Zunaed Siddique c Utseya b SW Masakadza 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: Zimbabwe get the second wicket, Junaid goes, he flicks it in the air on the onside, Utseya at square leg dives sideways to his right and plucks the ball with one hand in the air, excellent stuff from Utseya, the small crowd present at the ground are stunned.

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Raqibul Hasan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan lbw b Utseya 12 (25b 1x4 0x6 48m) SR: 48

dismissalComment.html: Utseya strikes for Zimbabwe, it was too full for the sweep and he misses it and the ball strikes the pad in line and a loud shout, given by the umpire. Bangladesh are three down for 47

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c †Taibu b Utseya 33 (61b 6x4 0x6 88m) SR: 54.09

dismissalComment.html: sweeps and gets a glove and the ball lobs up in the air behind the wicket on the onside, Taibu leaps backwards and takes a splendid catch to dismiss Kayes.

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c SW Masakadza b Utseya 63 (73b 5x4 1x6 86m) SR: 86.3

dismissalComment.html: sweeps it well in the air but unlucky to pick out the fielder at deep backward square leg, Maskadza takes the catch. A good knock from Mushfiqur comes to an end.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Utseya 73 (91b 5x4 0x6 132m) SR: 80.21

dismissalComment.html: a terrible shot to get out, he misses the reverse scoop to a full delivery and he was struck on the pad in front of the stumps and the umpire had no other choice but to give it in favor of the bowler.

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Sohrawordi Shuvo st †Taibu b Price 8 (9b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: wicket for Price as Shuvo charges down the track and looks to go big on the onside, misses it completely and an easy take for Taibu, who gets rid of the bails to dismiss Shuvo.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Junaid Siddique b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Junaid Siddique b Abdur Razzak 15 (28b 0x4 0x6 37m) SR: 53.57

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery, Taylor stays in the crease and pokes at the delivery as it was turning away, gets the edge and through to Junaid at first slip. Zimbabwe lose their third wicket.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha lbw b Abdur Razzak 7 (10b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: arm ball does the trick for Razzak, comes in with the arm and Chibhabha on the back foot is struck on the pad in line with the stumps and a loud shout, given by the umpire, Razzak strikes in his first over.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Abdur Razzak 3 (13b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 23.07

dismissalComment.html: tosses it up nicely, teasing Masakadza, comes down the track and looking to go down the ground on the onside, the turn misses the bat and through to Mushfiqur, who gets the rid of the stumps to dismiss Masakadza.

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tatenda Taibu b Mashrafe Mortaza 3 (23b 0x4 0x6 40m) SR: 13.04

dismissalComment.html: Mortaza cleans up Taibu, it was on a length and Taibu misjuding the line, moves forward and shoulders arms and then he realizes that he has made a mistake as the ball disturbs the timber. Zimbabwe are completely down now.

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shafiul Islam 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: edge and gone, Shafiul strikes picks up his first wicket, pitches it back of a length and makes it move away, Ervine feels for it and gets the edge through to Mushfiqur, who is happy to accept it. Zimbabwe in a spot of bother and are reeling at 39 for 4.

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva lbw b Abdur Razzak 5 (18b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 27.77

dismissalComment.html: fuller on the middle stump. Chakabva looks to have a swipe across the line. When you tend to do it, you have to ensure you get some bat on it, Chakabva doesn't and he is plumb in front. In fact Chakabva was set up for the dismissal as he was beaten with the turn two deliveries ago and now he slips a straight one

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya c Imrul Kayes b Shafiul Islam 67 (101b 3x4 3x6 130m) SR: 66.33

dismissalComment.html: full toss and Utseya down the track, hits it in the air to deep midwicket and Kayes takes the catch. The umpires check if it was a noball, but it is fine.

dismissalText.long: st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 24 (41b 4x4 0x6 40m) SR: 58.53

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery from Shakib, spins and turns away as Cremer misses the drive, Mushfiqur collects the ball and whips off the bails to dismiss Cremer.

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shingi Masakadza c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shafiul Islam 14 (16b 3x4 0x6 16m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: short delivery outside the off stump, upper cuts and slices it high in the air and behind the wicket on the off side, Mushfiqur calls for it and settles under the ball to take the catch.

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sohrawordi Shuvo b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Ray Price c Sohrawordi Shuvo b Shafiul Islam 14 (24b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: Price backs away and chips it in the air to Shuvo at extra cover, Shafiul and Price face off, few words being uttered. A jig from Shuvo.

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 29 runs, 3 wickets)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 11 runs, 2 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 14.2 overs (86 balls), Extras 7
Drinks: Bangladesh - 60/3 in 16.0 overs (Imrul Kayes 29, Shakib Al Hasan 9)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 26.0 overs (156 balls), Extras 12
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 63 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 17, Mushfiqur Rahim 32, Ex 1)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 138/4 in 34.0 overs (Shakib Al Hasan 44, Mushfiqur Rahim 35)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 36.4 overs (220 balls), Extras 13
Shakib Al Hasan: 50 off 68 balls, 96 mins (2 x 4)
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 62 balls, 72 mins (5 x 4)
5th Wicket: 100 runs in 122 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 46, Mushfiqur Rahim 52, Ex 2)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 44.6 overs (270 balls), Extras 17
Powerplay 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0 (Batting side)
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 246/7 in 50.0 overs (Naeem Islam 23, Mashrafe Mortaza 11)
Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 29 runs, 3 wickets)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 11 runs, 2 wickets)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 42/5 in 17.0 overs (RW Chakabva 1, P Utseya 1)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 19.2 overs (116 balls), Extras 7
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 33.3 overs (201 balls), Extras 9
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 120/8 in 36.5 overs (P Utseya 34)
Zimbabwe: 150 runs in 43.2 overs (260 balls), Extras 17
Powerplay 3: Overs 45.1 - 50.0 (Batting side)
P Utseya: 50 off 95 balls, 122 mins (2 x 4, 1 x 6)

stories.title: Abdur Razzak is making the difference - Alan Butcher
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe: Abdur Razzak is making the difference - Alan Butcher
stories.summary: Alan Butcher, the Zimbabwe coach, has said Abdur Razzak, the Bangladesh left-arm spinner, has been the difference between the two sides during their ODI series in Bangladesh

image.caption: Abdur Razzak bowls during his Man-of-the-Match performance
image.longCaption: Abdur Razzak bowls during his Man-of-the-Match performance, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 6, 2010

stories.title: Razzak's four secures comfortable win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI: Abdur Razzak's four secures comfortable win
stories.summary: Abdur Razzak continued his torment of Zimbabwe in this series, his quick strikes decapitating the chase and putting Bangladesh on course to take a 2-1 lead in the five-match series

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan and Abdur Razzak celebrate one of Razzak's four wickets
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan and Abdur Razzak celebrate one of Razzak's four wickets, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 6, 2010

stories.title: Zimbabwe hope to tackle spin threat
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur: Zimbabwe hope to tackle spin threat
stories.summary: ESPNcricinfo previews the third ODI between Bangladesh and Zimbabwe in Mirpur

image.caption: Abdur Razzak's five wickets included a hat-trick
image.longCaption: Abdur Razzak's five wickets included a hat-trick, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, December 3, 2010

stories.title: 'I need time to get my rhythm back' - Mortaza
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe: Mashrafe Mortaza asks for more time to regain form
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza has reacted to criticism about his performance in the first two ODIs against Zimbabwe by calling for more match practice following his return to the national team from injury

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza speaks to the press
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza speaks to the press, Belfast, July 14, 2010

image.caption: Zimbabwe celebrate the dismissal of Raqibul Hasan for 12
image.longCaption: Zimbabwe celebrate the dismissal of Raqibul Hasan for 12, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 6, 2010

stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe: Abdur Razzak is making the difference - Alan Butcher
stories.summary: Alan Butcher, the Zimbabwe coach, has said Abdur Razzak, the Bangladesh left-arm spinner, has been the difference between the two sides during their ODI series in Bangladesh

image.caption: Abdur Razzak bowls during his Man-of-the-Match performance
image.longCaption: Abdur Razzak bowls during his Man-of-the-Match performance, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 6, 2010

stories.title: Razzak's four secures comfortable win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI: Abdur Razzak's four secures comfortable win
stories.summary: Abdur Razzak continued his torment of Zimbabwe in this series, his quick strikes decapitating the chase and putting Bangladesh on course to take a 2-1 lead in the five-match series

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan and Abdur Razzak celebrate one of Razzak's four wickets
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan and Abdur Razzak celebrate one of Razzak's four wickets, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 6, 2010

stories.title: Zimbabwe hope to tackle spin threat
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur: Zimbabwe hope to tackle spin threat
stories.summary: ESPNcricinfo previews the third ODI between Bangladesh and Zimbabwe in Mirpur

image.caption: Abdur Razzak's five wickets included a hat-trick
image.longCaption: Abdur Razzak's five wickets included a hat-trick, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, December 3, 2010

stories.title: 'I need time to get my rhythm back' - Mortaza
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe: Mashrafe Mortaza asks for more time to regain form
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza has reacted to criticism about his performance in the first two ODIs against Zimbabwe by calling for more match practice following his return to the national team from injury

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza speaks to the press
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza speaks to the press, Belfast, July 14, 2010
